title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended, hereby
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Electricity Regulation Act 1999
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 

(Electricity) Levy Order 2020. 

(2) This Order shall come into operation on 31 December 2020. 

(3) The Electricity Regulation Act, 1999 (Electricity) Levy Order, 2019 (S.I 

No.622 of 2019) is revoked as and from 1 January 2021
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited electricity regulation act 1999 (electricity) levy order 2020 (2) order shall come operation 31 december 2020 (3) electricity regulation act 1999 (electricity) levy order 2019 (s.i no.622 2019) revoked 1 january 2021

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended, hereby
heading: 3. This Order shall apply to the classes of electricity undertakings set out in
text_raw:
3. This Order shall apply to the classes of electricity undertakings set out in 

the Schedule to this Order ("relevant undertakings").

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended, hereby
heading: 4. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on each relevant undertaking. This levy will
text_raw:
4. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on each relevant undertaking. This levy will 

be payable in respect of each levy year. 

(2) The levy imposed by sub-article (1) shall be payable in quarterly 
instalments in each case no later than the day which is 30 days after the date on 
which a request for payment of the levy instalment is made by the Commission.
text_norm: 4 (1) levy hereby imposed relevant undertaking levy payable respect levy year (2) levy imposed sub-article (1) shall payable quarterly instalment case later day 30 day date request payment levy instalment made commission

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended, hereby
heading: 5. (1) The levy imposed shall be payable by each relevant undertaking
text_raw:
5. (1) The levy imposed shall be payable by each relevant undertaking 
separately for each activity of generation, transmission, distribution or supply, 
as the case may be, that is carried out by that relevant undertaking in Ireland. 

(2) The amount of the levy imposed on a relevant undertaking in respect of 

any quarter shall be a follows: 

(a) 

in the case of the transmission system operator, licensed under 
section 14 (1) (e) of the Act, a fixed payment of €281,832 

 
 
 
 
 4 [591] 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

in the case of the transmission system owner, licensed under 
section 14 (1) (f) of the Act, a fixed payment of €281,832 

in the case of the distribution system operator, licensed under 
section 14 (1) (g) of the Act, a fixed payment of €507,297 

in the case of the distribution system owner, licensed under 
section 14 (1) (k) of the Act, a fixed payment of €56,366 

in the case of a generator connected to the transmission or 
distribution system and where the generating units are registered 
under the Code, 7c per MWhr at the Trading Boundary, rounded 
to the nearest euro, payable on the relevant quantity for that 
quarter plus the difference between the actual quantity and the 
relevant quantity for the previous quarter; 

in the case of a generator with generating units below the de 
minimis threshold of 10MW which the relevant generator is not 
required to register under the Code and which are not so 
registered 7c per MWhr at the Trading Boundary, rounded to the 
nearest euro, payable on the relevant quantity for that quarter plus 
the difference between the actual quantity and the relevant 
quantity for the previous quarter; and: 

(a) 

the term “actual quantity” shall mean the quantity of 
electricity in MWhrs which has been generated at the 
Trading Boundary; and 

(b) 

the term “Trading Boundary” shall mean the boundary 
between the transmission and distribution systems. 

(g) 

in the case of a supplier 7c per MWhr of aggregated demand at 
the Trading Boundary, rounded to the nearest euro, payable on 
the relevant quantity for that quarter plus the difference between 
the actual quantity and the relevant quantity for the previous 
quarter. 

(h) 

in the case of an interconnector operator, licensed under section 
14 (1) (i) of the Act, a fixed payment of €22,547

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended, hereby
heading: 6. (1) Generators and suppliers shall -
text_raw:
6. (1) Generators and suppliers shall - 

(a) no later than the first day of each quarter, submit to the 
Commission a statement of the relevant quantity for that quarter; 
and thereafter; 

(b) within 25 working days of the end of each quarter, submit to the 

Commission 

(i) 

in the case of generators, a statement certified by the Single 
Electricity Market operator or the Meter Registration 
System Operator as appropriate, of the actual quantity for 
the relevant undertaking in the previous quarter; 

 
 
 [591] 5 

(ii) 

in the case of suppliers, a statement certified by the Single 
Electricity Market operator of the actual quantity for the 
relevant undertaking in the previous quarter. 

(2) Where a relevant undertaking does not submit a statement of the relevant 
quantity in accordance with Article 6(1) (a), the amount payable for that quarter 
shall be 115% of the relevant quantity for the previous quarter. This shall not 
apply to the first quarter where such a statement is required. 

(3) Where the amount paid by the relevant undertaking in accordance with 
Articles 4 and 5 in respect of the relevant quantity in any quarter is less than the 
actual quantity by reference to the said statement of actual quantity, the relevant 
undertaking concerned shall pay to the Commission the balance of the amount 
payable on the last day of the first month of the following quarter. 

(4) Where the amount paid by a relevant undertaking in accordance with 
Articles 5 and 6 in respect of any quarter is more than the amount payable by 
reference to the said statement of actual quantity, the Commission shall make an 
adjustment to the amount payable by the relevant undertaking in the following 
quarter.

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended, hereby
heading: 7. (1) Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 5 is not paid within
text_raw:
7. (1) Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 5 is not paid within 
the period for payment specified in Article 4, interest thereon shall accrue at the 
prescribed interest rate compounded monthly from the date when such payment 
is due until the same is made. 

(2) In this Regulation, "the prescribed interest rate" means a rate 2% per 

annum above the Euribor rate.
text_norm: 7 (1) amount falling paid article 5 paid within period payment specified article 4 interest thereon shall accrue prescribed interest rate compounded monthly date payment due made (2) regulation prescribed interest rate mean rate 2 per annum euribor rate

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended, hereby
heading: 8. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank
text_raw:
8. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank 
transfer or equivalent instantaneous transfer of funds to the bank account 
specified by the Commission. 

(2) Each relevant undertaking shall notify the Commission as soon as 
payment has been made, indicating the date on which payment was made and 
the name of the bank effecting payment. 

(3) A request for payment by the Commission to a relevant undertaking 
under this Order shall be made to each relevant undertaking in accordance with 
Section 4 of the Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [591] 

Schedule 

The relevant undertakings for the purposes of this Levy Order are a class 
consisting of any holders of a licence granted under Section 14 of the Act or a 
permit under Section 37 of the Principal Act. 

Sealed with the common seal of the Commission for 
Regulation of Utilities on 9 December, 2020. 

AOIFE MACEVILLY, 

Chairperson of the Commission. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [591] 7

title: on it by the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as amended, hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This order imposes a levy on certain specified classes of electricity undertakings, 
for the purpose of meeting expenses properly incurred by the Commission for 
Regulation of Utilities in the discharge of its functions under the Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 8 [591]
